lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: Troilus, thou coward Troilus, show thy head!

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: Were I the general, thou shouldst have my office Ere that correction. Troilus, I say! what, Troilus!

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: O traitor Diomed! turn thy false face, thou traitor, And pay thy life thou owest me for my horse!

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: Ill fight with him alone: stand, Diomed.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: He is my prize I will not look upon.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Come, both you cogging Greeks have at you both!

lines.speaker: hector
lines.text: Yea, Troilus O, well fought, my youngest brother!

lines.speaker: achilles
lines.text: Now do I see thee, ha! have at thee, Hector!

lines.speaker: achilles
lines.text: I do disdain thy courtesy, proud Trojan: Be happy that my arms are out of use: My rest and negligence befriends thee now, But thou anon shalt hear of me again Till when, go seek thy fortune.

lines.speaker: hector
lines.text: Fare thee well: I would have been much more a fresher man, Had I expected thee. How now, my brother!

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Ajax hath taen AEneas: shall it be No, by the flame of yonder glorious heaven, He shall not carry him: Ill be taen too, Or bring him off: fate, hear me what I say! I reck not though I end my life today.

lines.speaker: hector
lines.text: Stand, stand, thou Greek thou art a goodly mark: No wilt thou not I like thy armour well Ill frush it and unlock the rivets all, But Ill be master of it: wilt thou not, beast, abide Why, then fly on, Ill hunt thee for thy hide.
